name: Ambassador Spa Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was very pleasant but bathroom definitely needed updating. Staff very pleasant but seemed stretched at times as hotel was very busy. Housekeeping a bit haphazard. Quite expensive, but it was bank holiday weekend. Overall, a pleasant experience and would happily stay again.
reviews.title: Very busy hotel

reviews.text: I booked last minute for a 2 day break with my grandson. We were charged for 1 adult and 1 child (half price) which was very reasonable. Most other places I checked out charged for 2 adults. Our room and bathroom were very spacious and comfortable, but the view was none existent (an internal area) which was a shame as we had to have the light on all the time, despite being beautiful sunshine outside.It didn't bother us too much as obviously we were out most of the time. I also booked because of the pool, but it turned out my grandson could only use between 8am - 9am!!! or 5pm - 6pm, and I needed to accompany him. It was OK though as we did two 5-6's which was fine. The breakfasts were great, entirely self service, which needed to be constantly re-filled, but we managed a good feed. (perhaps more staff to oversee when things need replenishing?). Friendly staff - would come again. Chuckle brothers a good laugh!
reviews.title: 2nd stay here

reviews.text: Stayed here with my son for a few days, friendly staff, good food, good facilities my boy loved the small pool and close to the beach and town. coming back i'm sure very soon. Nothing was too much trouble when I asked for things for the room as well
reviews.title: Summer fun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: me and my partner live in scarborough but decided to have a "staycation" as we could not afford a holiday abroad. we got a rather cheap deal at £70 for a double room, 2 course meal and breakfast! food was lovely, pool area was ok needed a good deck scrub however and not very big, certainly not big enough for the bloke who thought he was some sort of Olympic swimmer and took up the whole pool! drinks pricey but then that is to be expected. only gripe was our double bed was 2 twin beds pushed together at uneven heights! at least make the mattresses equal if you're going to do that please! lovely staff and calming atmosphere!
reviews.title: lovely hotel-bit pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at The Ambassador a few weeks ago and we were not impressed.
reviews.title: Not a patch on what they promise
RELAXING BREAK WITH A VIEW
reviews.text: My partner booked this weekend break so that we could be pampered. We were not disappointed. He booked a room with a sea view and that is exactly what we got. The room was equipped with tea/coffee facility so it was lovely after our drive to the hotel, to relax with a coffee enjoying the beautiful view from our room window. The hotel has a zen garden with a sauna. There is a relaxation room which my partner and I enjoyed after having a shoulder and back massage. Whilst enjoying the peace and relaxing ambiance of the relaxation room you can have cocktails brought to the room via room service. There is plenty of choice for breakfast which is served in a tastefully decorated dining room. Check out time of 10am was a little early we thought however we asked the staff if we could extend our leaving time to 11.30am and there was no problem or charge for this. During our stay I was disappointed that there was a problem with the swimming pool and therefore I was unable to have an early morning swim before breakfast on the day that we were leaving. As we were checking our we were asked if we had enjoyed our stay and I mentioned my disappointment with the pool and immediately we were told that now that the problem with the pool had been resolved we were most welcome to stay and enjoy this facility. We thought this was a lovely gesture however we had already made arrangements for the rest of the day. Car parking was in the street outside of the hotel but this was free as the hotel provides its guest with a disc to display in their car to cover all of the stay. The hotel do pamper day packages and I shall certainly be returning for one of these. We had a perfect weekend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would not specifically recommend the Ambassador, but it was not bad either. When we arrived I was actually pleasantly surprised with the bar and dining area, but then the room was not very nice. The bathroom especially could do with some updating. The view from the room was very nice though, and the room was clean. A lot of noise in the morning though coming from the corridor, sound insulation not the best! I have to say though that the staff of the hotel was very nice, and the breakfast was good. We also had a wedding dinner at that hotel and the food was good. All in all not a bad hotel, but I would stay in another hotel the next time around.
reviews.title: Not bad, but not very good either

reviews.text: We were over charged on paying for the room however we did book online and were refunded on our room tab however in the hotel bar we got a drink and ordered some food myself the croquer Monsieur and my fiancé a roast beef sandwich. We waited 35 minutes as a waiter approached us apologising for our wait and said it would be another 10 mins or so but offered us a free drink which we thought fair enough and accepted. 10 mins pass and my fiancés food arrives and the waiter apoligies again and come out with a bowl of fresh mussels and places them down in front of me, obliviously which I never ordered he apoilgies endlessly and goes off to the kitchen arriving another 10 mins or so with my food and tells us that are food will be taken off the bill, at that point I had went past being hungry but the food was lovely and we received all our money back drinks included. Lovely hotel though just smelly toilets near lift but spa was lovely and the bar cocktails are gorgeous but small!
reviews.title: The hotel was nice but serve was poor
Spa day
reviews.text: My daughter and I spent a lovely day here. The staff couldn't have been more pleasant and helpful. The Spa area was really clean, the pool warm, the food good, the location great for lungfuls of fresh sea air and the relaxation room did what it said on the tin. We didn't see in the bedrooms but the rest of it was ok. Not newly decorated but good enough. We didn't go to inspect the decor but to relax in pleasant surroundings and we did just that.

I got married here last year and everything was perfect! All my family stayed at the hotel and loved their rooms as did we! The staff went above and beyond to make our day perfect! The food was fantastic right through to breakfast the next day! Last night we went for our anniversary meal which we got as part of our wedding package! Again the staff were amazing and our 3 course meal was gorgeous!! Can't believe some of the reviews on here! They must not of been in the same hotel as me!!!
reviews.title: Amazing hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When my fiancé finally decided to put a ring on it, there was only one venue we wanted. After previously attending a christening in the Ambassadors Bronte suite and being utterly impressed, we would not have considered anywhere else.
reviews.title: Fabulous wedding venue

reviews.text: After several meetings with the wedding organisers there, Hayley and Kieren, we knew we had made a wise decision. I am a picky pain and this trait of mine was not only tolerated, but actively indulged! From pestering emails to Kieren (many!!....always promptly and politely responded to) to allowing me use of the room the day before to set up an example table and "play" with how and where i wanted things to be. After 18 months planning, handing over the reins to Kieren and his team was akin to handing over my first born. They could not have done a better job.
reviews.title: Over priced for what it is

reviews.text: The ceremony room was beautifully understated, tastefully decorated and when I saw the reception room, everything set out as I had dreamt, I could have wept. The meal was delicious, served by courteous and efficient staff, the transition from day to evening reception seamless.
reviews.title: Pamper Spa Day

reviews.text: The evening country buffet was fab, everyone loved it, and the table was replenished with no question after everyone had over indulged!!
reviews.title: Still has potential, but..........

reviews.text: Our wedding day was stress free, down to the Ambassadors team, everything ran like clockwork, from requesting a liquidised meal at the last minute, to the manager offering to go to the florists himself to pick up extra buttonholes when we thought we were short, nothing was too much trouble.
reviews.title: Superb location, nice hotel in certain areas, needs better cleaning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had one night here, had a sea view which was lovely we only came to this resort to visit my elderly Dad so we are used to staying in run down old hotels in Scarborough, however we actually thought that with the money we paid for this, it would have been much better, Oh dear it wasn't, we had no hot water, the bathroom was really dated and creaky, the shower was rubbish... just a tiny trickle drizzles out, its really time to do something about it, surely the staff could have swilled down the front step from Seagull mess, the whole of Scarborough was suffering from being splattered with gross mess form those dreadful birds, I would suggest that if this is going to remain a tourist Town then someone needs to think it through and get rid of the sea gulls. Talk to St Ives they have got rid!!!! and its a far better please to visit. Eve our car this morning had a flier on it telling us we could have a hand car wash!!! Yes our car was splattered with the mess!!!! nasty...... stuff. I will still have to come back whilst I have my Dad living in the area, so I am stuck with it but I will not stay here again not for that money!!!! and the food was cold and greasy!!!! £119:00 for 1 night sea view on the side area of the hotel, poor food, and the sandwiches we had at lunch time cost over £20:00 I consider very over priced. the pool looked ok but we didn't try it as the rest of the place was grimy, so I dread to think if the pool was clean.
reviews.title: Oh dear me! not as pleassant a saty as I would have liked

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Shame really as the place could be stunning, its in a good area. One other tip to the management ask your customers if they have enjoyed their stay when they leave, no one asked us, if they had we could have mentioned a few things
reviews.title: Our last time at the Ambassador

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visit Scarborough most years and have stayed at the Ambassador at least four times over the last 6 or 7 years, either as a couple of with family. We always opt for a sea view as the views are truly stunning. Despite some refurbishment and the introduction of a spa, we won't be returning again. As mentioned in other reviews the toilets in the downstairs corridor do smell dreadful, and there is no attention to detail regarding the cleanliness of the rooms. We asked for a sea view room and were put in a small double room (I think it was 315) which was cramped and very small and dark, we requested and paid for an upgrade to a larger bay window room which was great, although the shower is not powerful and the temperature a little hit and miss. However the main reason why we won't be returning again is that the breakfast options are limited and is now fully self service, you even have to toast your own bread and make a cup of tea!!. This arrangement leads to long delays depending on the time to decide to go for breakfast as you wait for the toaster, or queue up for hot food or to make tea etc. Part of the enjoyment of being on holiday is having a delicious breakfast served at your table and having menu choices. Finally I would ask where has the customer service gone? We stayed 3 nights, and only once did a member of restaurant staff wish us a 'good morning', the others avoided eye contact and no-one smiled! Such a shame, as we used to rave about the Ambassador, we will be back to Scarborough as we love this coast, but this was our last time at the Ambassador!
reviews.title: They were only too happy to mug us off.

reviews.text: Booked a "Junior Suite" through LateRooms for an anniversary weekend with my fiancee. Got to the hotel and booked into the room, realised that the room did not have the "luxury bathroom" I had paid for, nor did it have the numerous large bay windows I saw on the photos online. Having paid £169 for the single night I felt I deserved an explanation and called down to reception asking them to confirm I had been put in the Junior Suite. I was told that I hadn't been and that they would not swap me to the room I had booked well in advance. I found out the room we were in was £99 per night and was furious that the hotel were only too happy for me to pay the original £169 for it had I not brought the issue to light. I got a nonchalant "apology" and reduction to the proper rate but I wanted the Suite I booked and to be able to trust the hotel. No chance.
reviews.title: Poor value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was poor. The furniture had been pulled and picked at and was damaged. The 70s style bathroom contained a shower that struggled to deliver a drizzle of water, never mind anything resembling decent water pressure and the mattress was like a concrete slab. I don't mind firm but that was way too far. There was also sign of some bodily substance (and I know what I thought it was but will keep it quiet for the sake of decency) on the throw over the bottom of the bed.
reviews.title: weekend break

Pamper yourselves with a selection of rejuvenating and highly effective treatments that work in natural synergy with your skin, body & mind. Indulge in our unique multi-sensory Heat & Aqua retreat experience suite, Mud Rasul, rooftop Zen Garden & indulgent Treatment Rooms, which are the very essence of luxurious relaxation. Indulge your tastebuds on modern British cuisine in our boutique View Bistro & Bar Lounge. Shake it up with our Mixology Masterclass sessions where your group can learn how to stir up the perfect cocktail! Escape to our boutique bolthole by the sea! We’re perfect for group getaways, weddings, conferencing & events. All guests receive a boutique bedroom, free wi-fi, free parking permit with the majority of our rooms boasting stunning Sea-Views of the South Bay, Castle & Harbour!
